title: Album Page, "Pilaster, Certosa di Pavia, and Hanging Lamp, Sant'Anastasia, Verona", October 8, 1887
medium: Brush and watercolor, graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, clockwise from top right corner: (inscribed in circle) 66 / 77; Iron Lamp / St. Anastasia / Verona / Oct 8th 1887; Pilaster / About 60 centimeters high / Certoza - about 20 in high / October 2nd, 1887.
description: Vertical sheets with two drawings.  In the center is an elaborately pierced iron lamp, like a basket, suspended from two chains made of s-shaped links that hang from a delicate leafy bracket.  Above is a pilaster drawn so that its orientation on the page is horizontal.  It is rendered in graphite without any wash, perhaps to indicate the material was marble.  The pilaster has a panel of vase-like and leafy ornament, with an elaborate capital above.

tombstone.epitaph:
Album Page, "Pilaster, Certosa di Pavia, and Hanging Lamp, Sant'Anastasia, Verona", October 8, 1887.
October 8, 1887. Brush and watercolor, graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-143.
